last_episode_to_air.name: A Breed Apart
last_episode_to_air.overview: Spot visits the dog show to discover his breeding.  Mr. Jolly's father visits, but Mr. Jolly doesn't want to see him.

name: Teacher's Pet
overview: Tired of being a dog, Spot the Dog disguises himself as a boy named Scott and goes to school! With the help of his owner, Leonard, the duo try to keep his deception a secret.

episodes.name: Muttamorphosis
episodes.overview: Spot is jealous of Leonard's daily journey to school, so he pretends to be a boy and goes to school

episodes.name: Pet Project
episodes.overview: Leonard and Scott have to bring their pets to school, but Scott doesn't have a pet: he is a pet.

episodes.name: Movin' on Pup
episodes.overview: Scott is promoted to 5th grade and has to leave Leonard behind.

episodes.name: Escaping Dog Trick
episodes.overview: A new security fence threatens Scott's ability to go to school.

episodes.name: A Lick is Still a Kiss
episodes.overview: No one can figure out how Leonard knows what Leslie's lipstick tastes like. Spot knows.

episodes.name: Being Mrs. Leadready
episodes.overview: Spot needs someone to play his mother at parent-teacher conference night.

episodes.name: Let Sleep-Over Dogs Lie
episodes.overview: Scott and Leonard go to their first sleep-over.

episodes.name: Costume Pity Party
episodes.overview: Leonard doesn't want to wear a costume because some bully picked on him a year ago that Halloween.  After telling that story, Mr. Jolly starts to cry too much that he ends up dehydrating himself!

episodes.name: Scott's Honor
episodes.overview: Scott joins the Junior Boy Rangers.

episodes.name: Fifi
episodes.overview: Scott falls in love with a circus dog.

episodes.name: Bad to the Bone
episodes.overview: After Scott gets in trouble on a field trip, he decides to be bad forever.

episodes.name: Always Knock the Postman Twice
episodes.overview: Scott can't control his hatred of mailmen.

episodes.name: You Can't Bite City Hall
episodes.overview: The city wants to turn the dog park into a skateboard park and Scott can't decide which side he's on.

episodes.name: A Dog for All Seasons
episodes.overview: Mrs. Helperman has to rewrite the Christmas play overnight. Spot searches for his Christmas heritage.

episodes.name: Tallulahpalooza
episodes.overview: Principal Strickler's cat stays with the Leadreadys and disrupts Leonard and Scott's plans for laser tag and pizza.

episodes.name: Saving Mr. Jolly
episodes.overview: Pretty Boy and Mr. Jolly both think the other is missing so they go to school in search of Leonard's help

episodes.name: Rule of Paw
episodes.overview: Scott takes his new role as playground safety monitor a bit too seriously.

episodes.name: Never Take Candy from a Kindergartner
episodes.overview: A kindergartener has a crush on Leonard.  Pretty Boy and Mr. Jolly complete to give up bad habits.

episodes.name: A Few Good Boys
episodes.overview: Leonard and Scott hate their new Junior Boy Ranger assignments: Leonard has to spend the day with senior citizens and Scott has to look after cats.  Meanwhile, Mr. Jolly and Pretty Boy are fed up with reruns and turn to the internet.

episodes.name: Bad Fur Day
episodes.overview: Scott and Leonard both get haircuts and worry about their appearance in school the next day.  Mr. Jolly writes a fan letter to a model.

episodes.name: The Tale of the Telltale Taffy
episodes.overview: Leonard goes trick-or-treating against his mother's wishes.  Mr. Jolly and Pretty Boy suspect a stray cat of being a vampire.

episodes.name: Don't Count Your Chickies Before They Hatch
episodes.overview: Scott is thrilled at a chance to go the upcoming air show.  But it conflicts with his class assignment to watch over chicken eggs.

episodes.name: Strickler's Pet
episodes.overview: Principal Strickler vows that he will shave his head and paint it purple if the school reads 20,000 books.  But when Scott says that he'll read them all himself, Strickler knows he's in trouble. So, in order to keep Scott away from reading, Strickler employs him as his special assistant-- and keeps him especially busy.

episodes.name: Fresh 'n' Frozey Chocolachino
episodes.overview: Leonard asks his mom for a brand-new scooter that he saw in a magazine, but she suggests that Leonard should work for it, so he and Scott open up a lemonade stand. Unfortunately, there are already several lemonade stands on his block. So, while Leonard is sulking over having no ideas as to how to get his skateboard, Scott comes up with a revolutionary dish-- Fresh and Frozey Chocolachino. The Chocolachinos start selling like hot cakes, but Scott and Leonard run out of ingredients. Once again, Leonard starts sulking, while Scott starts thinking. This time, Scott comes up with something less than revolutionary-- ice. Scott masquerades the ice as low-calorie Chocolachinos, hoping the public would be gullible enough to buy any. They do, and when the realize it's just ice, the demand refunds.

episodes.name: The Grass Seed is Always Greener...
episodes.overview: Pretty Boy is saddled with PMS-- Pre Migrational Syndrome-- a syndrome that only occurs in that time of the year, fall, when birds begin to feel like migrating down south for winter. Pretty Boy escapes the house, and begins migrating with another bird-- a cool cat with no name. So, while Leonard and Scott go out to look for Pretty Boy, Mr. Jolly vows he will never eat again until ""Pretty Boy is restored to his cage once more.""

episodes.name: No Substitutions, Please
episodes.overview: Everyone in the class is excited when a substitute teacher takes over ... except Scott.

episodes.name: Don't It Make My Brown Eyes Green
episodes.overview: Scott teaches Leonard how to play fetch-- or fetch-it, after Leonard says it's boring. That backfires the next day in school, when everyone is bored, trying to think of something to do. While Scott is off getting a drink of water, Leonard teaches everyone the game of Fetch-it-ball, which is just fetch, only with teams, and scoring.  When Scott comes back from his drink of water and finds everyone playing fetch, he's surprised. When he finds out he didn't get any credit for fetch-it ... ball, he's even more surprised, and begins to get a little jealous. Later that day, while Scott tries to come up with a game to combat the ""grand game of fetch-it"", the fourth graders, led by Leonard, get pummeled by the fifth graders in fetch-it-ball.

episodes.name: Party Animal
episodes.overview: Spot organizes a birthday party for Leonard against his wishes.

episodes.name: Mr. Jolly: Man...or Mouser?
episodes.overview: Leonard bets his mom that Mr. Jolly can catch a mouse.

episodes.name: What Does Sweat Have to Do with It?
episodes.overview: It's time for the fourth grade class to go square dancing, and when Leonard is paired up with the gal-of-his dreams, Leslie, he's afraid she won't want to dance with him because of his sweaty hands.  Meanwhile, Mr. Jolly isn't as jolly as he used to be ... since he's lactose intolerant!

episodes.name: DogFight
episodes.overview: Leonard can't play basketball very well, so Scott teaches him.   The two are then challenged by 2 fifth graders to a two-on-two   game. After being congratulated, Scott and Leonard have an    argument on a bad pass. Then they are told to fight each other.   But Scott has a plan...

episodes.name: Taint Valentine's Day
episodes.overview: Spot plays Cupid for Scott while Mr. Jolly plays Cyrano for Pretty Boy.

episodes.name: Science Not Fair
episodes.overview: Scott and Leonard are both working on their science project. As Leonard seeing why dogs react to the silent whistle, Scott starts bragging about how better his is. Scott later on shows it to Leonard. Miss Helperman passes by and sees it, believing its Leonard. She tells him to take this project no matter what when he tries to tell her it is not his. Scott says since he wins alot in knowledge, he think Leonard deserves a chance to feel that glory and that he'll take his friend's project on the whistles. The next day, everyone except Scott have the same project causing many problem for Leonard. When the judges go up to Scott (The whistle one), they say his is more better because he researched like a real scientist and wins the fair. Scott feels guilty that he won, but he wouldn't have done it without Leonard.

episodes.name: To Bee or Not to Bee?
episodes.overview: Scott becomes the school's spelling bee champ. Pretty Boy teaches Mr. Jolly how to sing.

episodes.name: One Dog's Junk
episodes.overview: Spots chew toy is accidently sold at a yard sale and it gets in the hands of Ian.

episodes.name: Take Me out of the Ballgame
episodes.overview: Leonard and Scott are trying out for baseball season. When Scott    realises he can't join the team, he decides to teach Leonard the game.

episodes.name: Inspector Leadready II
episodes.overview: When Leonard is accused of breaking Leslie's map, Leonard and    Scott work together to find the culprit.

episodes.name: The Turkey That Came to Dinner
episodes.overview: Leonard's granny visits but she's brought a live turkey that tries to befriend the pets.

episodes.name: Double Dog Dare
episodes.overview: In a Truth or Dare game, Leonard is dared to tell everyone who his favorite girl in the class is. If he admits that it's Leslie then everybody might laugh at him and it'll ruin him and Leslie's friendship and if he lies and says he has a crush on Younghee, then he might break Leslie's heart, so he decides to try a super hard dare in place of telling the truth.

episodes.name: Attack of the 50 Inch Girl
episodes.overview: A new girl comes to school and torments Spot.

episodes.name: The Flipper
episodes.overview: After Scott teaches Leonard, he becomes the Flipper when he becomes an expert at flipping cards into a circle. But after a bit of tension between the two, they have a final showdown. In the meantime, Mr. Jolly makes buildings out of cards as Pretty Boy does various methods to blow it down.

episodes.name: The Blight Before Christmas
episodes.overview: While Leonard hopes to get a Mach III Game Command for Christmas, Spot searches for a lost dog hoping to collect a $500.00 reward to buy stuff for himself.

episodes.name: All About Eavesdropping
episodes.overview: Leornard and Scott entertain at a girl's party and end up listening to a secret conversation.

episodes.name: The Nose Knows
episodes.overview: Scott realizes that the Thursday Surprise is dog food.

episodes.name: Don't Bite the Hound That Feeds You
episodes.overview: Spot gets fleas who talk in a French accent.

episodes.name: A Breed Apart
episodes.overview: Spot visits the dog show to discover his breeding.  Mr. Jolly's father visits, but Mr. Jolly doesn't want to see him.
